newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria lev eases, nears 1,000-per-mark peg rate.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria lev eases, nears 1,000-per-mark peg rate.

text.p: The lev ended down at 995-997 per mark from the morning's 993-996, moving towards the 1,000-per-mark currency board peg, to take effect on July 1, dealers said.

* The central bank was seen buying marks on the domestic market at 995 levs to bring the local currency closer to the planned peg rate and to increase its mark reserves ahead of the implementation of the currency board system.
* Central bank officials were unavailable for comment.
* The lev closed at 1,723-1,726 to the dollar, down from the opening's 1,715-1,720, adjusting to the lev/mark and the mark/dollar cross on global markets.

* Traders expected local banks to trade the lev between 995-1,000 per mark from July 1 and to adjust exchange rates for the lev against other major currencies to their respective exchange rates against the mark on international markets. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 91188
